news uk-news prince-harry-branded-professional-whinger-"Ann Widdecombe says we should ‘ignore’ Harry and MeghanByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | comments Prince Harry has been branded a professional whinger unaware of his privilege by former Brexit Party MEP Ann Widdecombe.Ann Widdecombe also criticised the Sussexesapos victim mentality saying the couple are privileged beyond belief. She added she disliked how the Duke of Sussex is has continued to speak about his family despite leaving the institution. Ms Widdecombe did not hold her feelings back about the royal couple.She told Express : On a more serious note, I think Harry is very damaging to the royals, he must be personally very hurtful to the Queen.And I think they should keep quiet, I mean they are privileged beyond belief and they moan that they were cut off financially.  Learn all about the secretive personal lives and history of the Royal Family as youaposve never seen them before in Amazonaposs best selling Royal Historical Biographies SEE THE DEALS HERE What a joke, million Calornia mansion, and itaposs just unbelievable. They are privileged, they are professional victims, they are professional whingers and having said that they wanted privacy theyaposve done nothing except publicise every last detail of le.It comes as reports have suggested the Sussexes are keen to visit the UK after quitting as senior royals and moving to Calornia early last year.Harry has only ed to the UK twice since the move, while Meghan and two-year-old Archie have not been back so far.Meanwhile, Harry and Meghanaposs newborn daughter Lilibet has not been to the UK after being born in Calornia in June and is yet to meet her great-grandmother the Queen or her grandfather Prince Charles.And according to Katie Nicholl, a royal expert and author of Harry And Meghan: Le, Loss, And Love told Closer magazine : Christmas is being looked at as an opportunity. There may be a softening, which could pave the way for a healing of the family rt.It’s certainly what the Queen wants. Prince Charles would like to see his grandchildren. A meet-up suggests they hope to move on and sort things out. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex spoke to Oprah Winfrey in March and made a series of claims about the family - including one member reportedly speculating about what colour Archieaposs skin would be and how the palace allegedly failed to support Meghan when she struggled with her mental health. Since then, Harry has done his own interviews where he has spoken about his struggles growing up as a member of the Royal Family. In early , Harry and Meghan stepped down as senior royals and moved to Canada before settling in Calornia where they are now raising their two children - Archie and Lilibet.The royal brothers have only reunited a few times this year, at Prince Philipaposs funeral and at the unveiling of a statue to their mum, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace on what would have been her th birthday.Comment MORE ON Ann WiddecombePrince HarryPrince Philip, Duke of EdinburghOprah WinfreyPrincess DianaPrince Charles, Prince of WalesKensington PalaceLoveRoyal FamilyMental healthPoliticsChristmas party" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: savvy woman transforms toilet harry
story: :root Savvy woman transforms toilet into Harry Potter-themed Bogwarts - for just £The Royal Mail cleaner had help from her partner Jamie, , as they embarked on the project to make the home they bought two years ago "about the things we love"Claire and her partner Jamie have transformed their downstairs toilet into a Harry Potter-themed world - named Bogwarts Image: Jam Press Claire Stephanie RileyByMilly VincentAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsA woman has transformed her downstairs toilet into a Harry Potter-themed world - named Bogwarts - complete with a broomstick, Marauderaposs Map wallpaper and giant Aragog model. Claire Stephanie Riley, , spent just £ to complete the magical look. The Royal Mail cleaner had help from her partner Jamie, , as they embarked on the project to make the home they bought two years ago about the things we love. Just like Hogwarts, the tiny bathroom features magical knick-knacks from top-to-bottom. It showcases the Marauderaposs Map on the walls to ensure occupants get their mischief managed. Claire, who also owns a dog grooming business, also displays her collection of wands, newspaper clippings from the movie franchise and miniature buildings from the fantasy world.  Even the soap and hand towels are Harry Potter-themed, with cuddly Harry and Hedwig toys looking back at you from the heated towel rail. Claire, from Wigan, said: I have always loved Harry Potter from the beginning. Itaposs just so magical it takes you to another world. Bogwarts came about when I found the Harry Potter wallpaper in BM. Not only is our downstairs loo done in Harry Potter but also our hallway that leads to it.  “My partner Jamie and I moved in around two years ago and we decided to make our home about things we love. “We donapost have any children, this is all for us... but when my friends come they love it… say itaposs their favourite place to go to the loo in. “We were having the house completely done up and we just thought for the downstairs loo and hallway it would be fun and we just came up with the name Bogwarts. “Lots more have been added over the months, more wands and other bits... itaposs something you can add on to as you go along.”  Claire also decoupaged her toilet roll holder with a dferent Harry Potter wallpaper and playing cards that she had lying around the home. Additionally, she put together a D collage of film memorabilia, including a Howler and a dark mark sign from hama beads, which is glued to the sink unit. Those with arachnophobia may want to avoid Bogwarts though, as thereaposs also a giant model of the filmaposs spider Aragog.  Claire added: “I made the toilet roll holder from bits of wallpaper we had left and Harry Potter playing cards and a few Harry Potter bits I had collected along the way. “I also made the D Harry Potter collage that hangs in the bathroom. The shelves are from IKEA and are great for putting things on and hanging other bits off. “The rest of the bits are what I have picked up and found along the way.” It isnapost the only room in the house with a theme. Other rooms are decorated with inspiration from Disney, Game of Thrones, and s cartoons. title: secrets ex greggs worker why
story: :root Secrets of an ex-Greggs worker - why Ill never eat there again after I saw too muchHeed my words next time youre in the mood for a steak bake - here are the secrets you never knew about your favourite high street bakery, writes former Greggs worker Shaun StaffWorking the till is the least favourite job, for good reason. People are horrible and hungry people are worse Image: Newcastle ChronicleopinionByShaun Staff:,  Sep | commentsIn  I hung up my hairnet for the final time after four years working for Greggs. I’ve never been back. And given you’re never more than . miles from a Greggs in any UK city centre, that’s some feat. For most people, when hunger strikes and you need food fast, the UK’s most accessible outlet is the perfect cure. Not for me. Though my heart yearns for a steak bake my head puts on the steak brakes. I saw too much. And I’m here to give you a glimpse behind the counter and reveal the secrets of working in Greggs.  You are being judged If you have ever visited the same Greggs twice, you’ve probably got a nickname based on your order,you’re lucky, or your appearance,you’re not. Two sausage rolls and a Dr Pepper, is it  How very predictable, Dr Pork. Sometimes harmless fun but often cruel and unforgiving, the servers have noticed your imperfections and they’re quietly talking about them from the moment you enter. They donapost want to serve you anyway Greggs staff arrive a couple of hours before opening, allowing  minutes to prep the food and  to argue about who has to serve it. Working the till is the least favourite job, for good reason. People are horrible and hungry people are worse. Strategies employed to avoid human interaction include slow trips upstairs to replenish stock, fake bouts of dizziness, extreme thirstand ducking down. If you’ve ever walked into an empty Greggs, you are probably not alone. The coffee machine is not broken But they won’t tell you that. If you order a black coffee at the exact moment one of the staff are about to make one for themselves, the machine might just spring into le. Any other time don’t ask. If your order is much more than a sausage roll you are officially annoying. Exceptions are made for friends, family, and the homeless in winter.  % friends and family discounts While the staff discount is generous, giving away food from Greggs is not allowed, presenting the perfect opportunity to get creative and innovate new ways to feed friends and family for free. “Here is that coffee you ordered, sir.” It’s a sausage roll wedged into a paper cup. The competition was fierce and ultimately cancelled when a hollowed out loaf loaded with cakes was intercepted by management. Your food may have been used as a weapon If you’ve ever been slapped in the face by a wet tomato, you’ll know how much it hurts. If you’ve ever slapped someone with a wet tomato, you’ll know how satisfying it is. Making  sandwiches is no fun unless you create it – and it’s a fact that baguettes make excellent swords. There is a likelihood any food you order has previously been used for violence – but at least the perpetrator was wearing gloves and a hairnet. There’s more to be fearful of – the ongoing civil war between weekend and weekday staff, the mythical beard net, and the inevitable three-stone weight gain for all employees. I won’t judge you for visiting Greggs, but I’m  years clean and will never eat there again.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Greggs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news staffy-whizzes-around-beach-chase-"Staffy owners genius trick to wear dog out on the beachByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Sep | commentsThe owner of a Staffordshire bull terrier has had dog lovers in fits of giggles after sharing her inventive way of tiring her dog out on the beach. Hayley Legge had taken her Staffy, Diesel, to Harlech Beach, near Porthmadog, Wales, for a run around when she got tired of throwing his ball in a game of fetch.In a video shared to theStaffies UK Facebook page, Hayley put Diesel’s ball in the back of a remote controlled car before zooming it across the sand with the eight-year-old dog chasing after it. She toldTeamDogs: “My other half was playing with his car on the beach and I was throwing Diesel’s ball. Then I said to Adam ‘Wouldn’t it be funnywe can put his ball on the car to save me throwing it’, so we did and it worked well. It gave my arm a rest!” In the minute long video, which has received over , likes in the private group, Hayley and Adam can be heard giggling at the dog behind the camera as he runs after the Traxxas Unlimited Desert Racer. Adam quipped: “He’s not giving up is he ” as Diesel is hot on the heels of the car wheels. One commenter dubbed the idea ‘genius’, with another adding: “That’s got to be the best way to walk a dog, ever.” TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. Search through hundreds of recommended walks, treats, toys and places to stay when youaposre on an adventure together. From dog-friendly pubs to product reviews and the latest news, you can snf it all out at TeamDogs. The Traxxas cars cost upwards of £ to buy, and other Staffy owners worried the dog might take a liking to it should Diesel have caught it. “Good idea until they catch it and start attacking the car,” one joked, while another said the dog had no chance - until the batteries run out. One asked Hayley how long it took before Diesel gave up the chase, to which the dog owner responded: “He didn’t! We gave up before he did.” Comment MORE ON TeamDogsDogs" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: stressed worried prince andrew staying
story: :root Exclusive: Stressed and worried Prince Andrew staying loyal to legal team despite concernsThe Duke of York now has  days to respond to the action launched by his accuser, alleged Jeffrey Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre. Royal insiders claimed the Duke has been stressed and worriedPrince Andrew has decided to stick to his legal team Image: REUTERSByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep Prince Andrew has decided to stick with his legal team as his newly appointed US attorney was officially served with legal papers launching a civil sex abuse case against the royal. The Duke of York now has  days to respond to the action launched by his accuser, former Jeffrey Epstein sex slave Virginia Giuffre. A source close to Andrew has claimed that despite his inner circle’s “deep reservations” that his “wall of silence” legal strategy was not working, he has decided to “keep faith and stay loyal” to his UK lawyer Gary Bloxsome of Blackfords. Royal insiders claimed that although the Duke has been stressed and worried over his predicament after Ms Giuffre accused him of sexually assaulting her three times in , the serving of legal papers effectively meant he had run out of time to change course.  However, his newly appointed US attorney Andrew Brettler has now taken over the Duke’s case after being appointed just weeks ago. A source claimed the US team were “astonished” at the long held strategy of “no comment” employed by the Duke and his team as he became engulfed in sex abuse allegations by former Jeffrey Epstein sex slave Virginia Giuffre. Another source close to Andrew said: “The Duke remains confident in his legal team and its strategy and is perfectly content to continue to follow their advice.” Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: tragic schoolgirl walked out moments
story: :root Tragic schoolgirl walked out moments after encore into path of Manchester Arena bomberOlivia Campbell-Hardy, , from Bury, was just five metres away from the suicide bomber when he detonated his deviceManchester bombing victim Olivia Campbell-HardyByJohn ScheerhoutLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Sep | commentsA schoolgirl who was “always making people laugh” was just five metres away from the Manchester Arena suicide bomber when he detonated his device, an inquiry has heard.Olivia Campbell-Hardy, , from Bury, left the concert hall after Ariana Grande had performed her encore and walked into the foyer toward the bomber.Nine seconds later, Salman Abedi detonated his device. She was seen lying motionless on the ground by CCTV, the public inquiry into the bombing heard.Olivia, known as Ollie or Liv, died from “unsurvivable” head and neck injuries and was one of the  people who died in the May  attack, reports the Manchester Evening News. She had attended the concert with her friend and around pm, had excitedly called her mother to say Ms Grande was about to come on stage.  Following the end of the concert, Olivia entered the City Room at .pm just seconds before the bomb went off, the inquiry heard. She was approximately five metres from Abedi at the moment of detonation. Footage showed her body did not move during the period after the bomb went off. A paramedic confirmed in a statement to the inquiry that he had placed a label on Olivia to identy that she was deceased.  A post-mortem examination concluded that Olivia had died of head and neck injuries while a  of experts appointed by the inquiry said her injuries were “unsurvivable”. Pathologists agreed that her death would have been “very rapid”, adding that it was likely that her injuries would have resulted in “immediate loss of consciousness”. Her mother, Charlotte Hodgson, told the inquiry that Olivia was “a beautul young girl who packed so much in her  years”, who loved sports, singing and make-up.  She said of her daughter: “She didnapost come into a room - she would make an entrance. She was always making people laugh and anything she did she could make it fun”. Olivia was a “hugely promising singer” for whom singing was “her le” and had previously auditioned for Britain’s Got Talent. In a statement from her father, Andrew Hardy, which was read out at the inquiry, he said Olivia loved spending time with her family and holidays, adding: “She was very much loved by all.” Her grandfather, Steve Goodman, told the inquiry Olivia was known for singing at family gatherings. Describing her as “loud and boisterous”, he said she was also “caring” and would always “fight for the underdog”. To her grandparents, “she was a joy”, he added. The chairman of the inquiry, Sir John Saunders, said: “Believe it or not there are times when even lawyers are lost for words and this is one of them. Can I just say, what a talent, what a waste and what a lovely person. title: uk weather forecast final mini
story: :root UK weather forecast: Final mini-heatwave of summer as Brits bask in C sunshineOn Thursday, London is predicted to see high temperatures of at least C before rising to C from FridayMost of England will be dry and bright Image: Humphrey NemarByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsParts of the UK will bask in balmy weather with a mini-heatwave forecast for the last time this year. The next three days will hit high temperatures of C in some regions. On Thursday London is predicted to see high temperatures of at least C before rising to C from Friday. But while the south and most of England and Wales will see warm, dry skies there will be ferocious winds and torrential rain further north.The Met Office has predicted apossevere gales and squally showersapos for the far north but with most areas staying aposdry, warm and fine.aposThe best conditions and high temperatures will be felt in the east and central parts of the UK, continuing over the coming days. Met Office meteorologist Alex Deakin told The Sun : “Plenty more sunshine across much of the country today.“Much of southern Scotland and certainly most of England and Wales will have another fine day of September sunshine. “Temperatures are responding to that sunshine, heading up into the low twenties - C, maybe C across parts of the south east.” Longer ranger forecasts had predicted the mercury will stay warm in many areas up to the weekend, with C forecast again in the coming days. And it could be the last of the balmy weather for . Speaking to the Express, forecaster Jim Dale, from the British Weather Services, said earlier that climate change has led to the UK’s summer often being extended into the first three weeks of September.Whereas in past decades the month would usher in autumn, it is not now unusual to see bright, dry and sunny weather well into the month, he explained. He said: “What we’re in for is an extended summary month for the first three weeks of September because of climate change. “What we are going into now is pretty weather, it’s very pleasing but it’s not probably a lot more than that.” UK weather forecast Today: Severe gales and squally showers at first across the far north, otherwise mostly dry, warm and fine with the best of any sunshine in eastern and central parts. Thicker cloud may bring some patchy rain at times to the west. Tonight: Mostly cloudy in the north and west with some rain or drizzle at times. Mostly dry with iable cloud and clear spells where. Becoming increasingly breezy especially in the north. Friday: Rather cloudy, especially in the west and north where some patchy rain is likely with the best of any sunshine in eastern parts. Breezy, particularly in northern areas. Feeling warm. Outlook for Saturday to Monday: Mainly fine and warm Saturday. Some rain for the northwest. Scattered showers overnight into Sunday, perhaps heavy in the east. Squally band of rain pushes east Sunday and into Monday. title: woman 28 critical condition three
story: :root Woman, , in critical condition and three children injured in devastating house fireThe terraced house in Tyntyla Road, Tonypandy, South Wales, broke out on Tuesday afternoon and left a number of people, including three children, requiring treatment for smoke inhalationThe blaze at the terraced house in Tyntyla Road, Tonypandy, South Wales, broke out on Tuesday afternoon Image: WalesOnline Rob BrowneByNathan Bevan:,  Sep A woman is in a critical condition and three children have been injured in a devastating house fire. The blaze at the terraced house in Tyntyla Road, Tonypandy, South Wales, broke out on Tuesday afternoon and left a number of people, including three children, requiring treatment for smoke inhalation.A -year-old man was arrested in connection with the offence in the early hours of Wednesday morning and remains in police custody, report Wales Online. Police and emergency services were called to the address at approximately .pm following several  calls. A -year-old woman trapped inside had to be extracted from the premises by fire and rescue officers and was taken to Morriston Hospital where she remains in a critical condition. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Neighbour Elwydd Jeffrey said: I have never seen such black smoke. It was so thick and dense you could hardly see through the window. I thought there would be no house left, thataposs how bad it was. A police investigation to establish the circumstances surrounding the incident is continuing. Detective Chief Inspector Sarah Lewis said: We are keeping an open mind as to what caused the fire and at this stage we cannot rule anything out.We have a team of officers who are working hard to establish what happened.If anybody does have information they should contact South Wales Police, giving occurrence number *.Click here or send a private message on Facebook Twitter.Alternatively, email: SWP@south-wales.police.uk or phone .Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON South Wales PoliceHospitalsHouse fires" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 30 transforms council flat
story: :root Woman, , transforms her council flat over lockdown into dream home for under £,Emma Campbell was able to give her apartment a new lease of le after feeling inspired during lockdown and has transformed her flat with a new kitchen, floors and furniture.Emma is a -year-old digital marketing trainer Image: Mercury Press  Media Ltd.ByShiler Mahmoudi:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA woman has created her dream home after transforming her council flat over lockdown for under £,. Emma Campbell, , has been living in her council flat since she was just -years-old. In that time, she was able to buy the flat for herself and has given it a dream makeover. She decided to transform her flat while in lockdown, and was able to achieve everything she wanted on a small budget. The digital marketing trainer said: It was awful when I first moved in. Whoever lived here before had really odd taste. In the kitchen, they had these hand-painted footprints going along the wall.  It wasnapost nice at all. She had been able to do some minor decorating when she first moved in, but it was when lockdown hit that she make the decision to give her flat a complete makeover. Most of the furniture is thrted, or just freebies I found on the side of the road, and lots of up-cycling, Emma explains.  I saved a lot of money in the bedroom and the living room because I had a go at plastering it myself.I got a lot of stuff, like the dining table, off Facebook Marketplace.She had initially asked a friend to install the bathroom, but it did not go quite to plan. He kind of left the job unfinished, so I had to try and do a lot of it myself.  I also tiled and painted the kitchen myself. I spend quite a lot of time in the kitchen so I wanted it to look really nice. Emma says that her friends could not believe the transformation, who have seen first hand the state of the flat initially. I was quite embarrassed by it at first, she said. I was sleeping on a futon, and my TV was just on a chair, it looked like something out of trainspotting.  Now, they canapost believe itaposs the same place. During lockdown just having to stay in the same space, and kind of hating it, is what gave me the motivation to make some changes. Working from home, at first I was just spending all my time in my bedroom. She added: Then, for my birthday my mum asked me what I wanted for my birthday and I just said aposhelpapos. So she came down and helped to motivate me, and help me move furniture around, and everything.  She spent a total of £, on the makeover, the most expensive being £, for a new kitchen. She had some new wooden floors put in for £, and bought a sofa for £. Her wallpaper was free as she collected samples from local shops, and her bath unit and sink cost a combined £.By buying a little bit extra with the weekly shop and putting it in the donation box located in-store, customers can help Lidl meet its target of donating million meals a year to those in need. Lidl is helping to tackle hunger in Britain’s communities through its Feed it Back scheme and has teamed up with partner Neighbourly to ensure any donated food will be put to good use every day.The key items to pop in the box are: Cereal Soup Pasta Rice Tinned tomatoes or pasta sauce Lentils, beans and pulses Tinned meat Tinned vegetables Tea and coffee Tinned fruit Biscuits UHT milk Fruit juice. Find out more about Lidlaposs Feed it Back scheme here. The dining table and chairs came to £, and she paid £ in labour costs. She gave the walls a splash of colour for £.  Emma shared the results on Facebook, which blew up and received over , comments. She said: I canapost believe the response itaposs got. I knew I didnapost want to live in a dark space, I wanted it really colourful and with lots of plants. When youaposre on a budget you just sort of make do with things, but this is definitely what I wanted. title: yorkshire grandad reassures neighbours after
story: :root Yorkshire grandad reassures neighbours after crocodile spotted in his back gardenNigel Holroyd, , Castleford, West Yorkshire, was confused after seeing a photo showing what was dubbed the Castleford Croc in his back gardenLocals were put on edge after the ft crocodile was spotted stalking in a back garden in CastlefordByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Sep | commentsA grandad has solved the mystery of a aposcrocodileapos running wild in his back garden. Bricklayer Nigel Holroyd was baffled when he saw what looked like a photo of his own property in the press, after a neighbour thought she saw a ft reptile stalking in the grass. That looks like my garden, the -year-old thought after spotting the grainy snap containing the mysterious creature, dubbed the aposCastleford Crocapos.It had been taken by exhausted nurse Sarah Jayne Ellis after her overnight sht at the hospital. When she checked back later it had gone and she assumed it must have been real, with her mind flashing back to reports of another croc sighting at a nearby nature reserve last year.Do you have a story that you think we should feature  Get in touch at webnews@mirror And while it was a crocodile in Nigelaposs garden, it wasnapost a real one.It’s just a plastic toy crocodile, he told , which had initially published the photo.I left it in the grass to scare off my neighbour’s cat from my garden, but I ended up scaring her. Nigel had bought the toy during a trip to Florida, in the US, in . It had been a gt for his son before being passed down to one-year-old grandson Robbie. He said his family all found the misunderstanding hilarious, adding: It’s certainly got out hand.  When the toy is not in use it lives in Nigelaposs garden shed.In similar news, police launched an urgent response following multiple reports of an escaped alligator in the US - only to find it was an inflatable crocodile.Residents were horried to spot the green reptile lurking in a pond in Stafford County, Virginia, last week and called officers for assistance. Police rushed to the scene after telling residents that it could be dangerous to approach the creature unarmed. But it runs out that the terrying alligator was simply an inflatable swimming pool toy. title: young mum fell front high
story: :root Young mum fell in front of high-speed train with her three-year-old daughterLeighane Redmond, , had been suffering from psychosis when she and Melsadie Parris died at Taplow Station, on  February  - a full inquest is due to be held into both deathsLeighane Melsadie Redmond, , and her three-year-old daughter Melsadie Adella-Rae Parris Image: south bedsnews agency_sbna_fairleysByMirror:,  Sep A young mother fell in front of a high-speed train in Buckinghamshire with her three-year-old daughter, killing them both. Leighane Redmond, , had been suffering from psychosis when she and Melsadie Parris died at Taplow Station, on  February .British Transport Police said at the time they were treating the case as murder-suicide and the results of their investigations were expected to be revealed when the full inquest takes place,Bucks Free Press reports.At a pre-inquest review hearing held at Beaconsfield Coroners’ Court today, Buckinghamshire Senior Coroner Crispin Butler agreed to requests from lawyers for Melsadie’s father Leroy Parris and her mother Yvette Redmond to adjourn the full inquest hearing. The hearing was due to last four weeks from November . No new date for the full inquest was set, but there will be a pre-trial review on November .  The court today heard of how the death of Ms Redmond and her daughter could have been the result of inadequate fencing and hoardings at Taplow Station. Ms Redmond’s mother wants to invite a rail expert to help establish whether her daughter was let down by rail and contractor firms that were operating at the station on the day of her death. Yvette Redmond’s lawyer, Caoilfhionn Gallagher QC, told the court she was concerned the other parties would “mark their own homework” when assessing what happened on the day of the tragedy. “It is essential to have an expert,” Ms Gallagher said.  “There are ious standards on the railway. Without expert assistance, it will not be possible to knowthe interested parties adhered to their responsibilities.” The lawyer said it was crucial to have an independent assessment. The comments come after the family of the victims raised concerns over the fencing and hoardings at Taplow Station, which was undergoing construction works when the incident took place. Questions were also raised at a previous pre-inquest review as to why station staff did not interfere when Ms Redmond, who had struggled with mental health issues, had been standing with her daughter on the  for more than an hour. Ben Compton QC, representing MTR Elizabeth Line raised questioned over whether there was a need for a rail expert in the matter. “I just question how much a pure rail expert can really help in this case. The question is how Leighane and Melisade were able to access the high-speed  in Taplow Station,” he said. The hearing had been adjourned after around two hours. Another pre-inquest review was expected to take place ahead of the full four-week inquest later this year.  The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. title: dad 24 who didnt vaccinated
story: :root Dad, , who didnt get vaccine as he heard it wasnt real dies from Covid-Patrick Burshia spoke from his intensive care bed in Montana, USA while struggling to catch his breath. He wanted to warn others to have the vaccine adding that he regretted not having itPatrick Burshia was in intensive careByKelly-Ann MillsReporter:,  Sep | commentsA young father who didnapost get the Covid- vaccine after believing it wasnapost real has died from the virus aged just . Patrick Burshia spoke from his intensive care bed in Montana, USA while struggling to catch his breath. He wanted to warn others to have the vaccine adding that he regretted not having it and said he would take it as soon as he could.Speaking through the glass of the coronavirus ward, he said: I would not wish this on my worst enemy.As soon as I can, Iaposm getting the vaccine, and I highly recommend anyone who hasnapost to do it because this is a very scary situation.  He told NBC reporter Gabe Gutierrez that he had been hearing aposa lot of propagandaapos, including from friends and family members who did not trust the vaccine. He said the claims included that it wasnapost a real vaccine and that it might contain a tracking chip that the government was trying to use on us. Mr Burshia soon took a turn for the worst and was put on a ventilator.  His nurse Chrissy Baxter fought back tears as she said: Every time we moved him we werenapost surethe end wasnapost going to be in that moment, so I just wanted to be there to hold his hand. He died over the weekend leaving behind a young son. title: diy bride spent just 3600
story: :root DIY bride spent just £, on her wedding day by making own dress and dessertsVictoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress, her husbands tie and a pair of sandals for herself - she also baked  meringues and created her own floral centrepiecesVictoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress by hand Image: Mercury Press  Media Ltd.ByJade CulverAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsA money-savvy bride spent just £ on her big day by making her own dress, decor and desserts. Victoria Croker, , saved thousands by crocheting her dress by hand, baking a iety of dessert meringues as well as creating her own centrepieces. The tattoo parlour general manager learned to crochet from her mum Laura Figlioa, , and her hobby helped save her thousands for her wedding day. Victoria, from New York, also used the leftover material to make a pair of sandals for herself and her husbandaposs tie. Victoria said: “It was always my dream to create my own wedding dress, I got to make it to my own specications, and it was super comfortable.  I was inspired by a few dferent crochet artists but I made the dress entirely by hand, I didn’t have a pattern for it. “With the off-cuts left over from the yarn, I managed to make myself some barefoot sandals for the day, my husband’s tie and pocket square. I also upcycled an old umbrella I had and got some yarn for that at a thrt store.”  Victoria was quoted more than £ for flowers and catering, and with dress prices in New York averaging out at thousands of pounds, she decided to put her skills to the test to slash the overall costs. In total, Victoria spent  hours and just under £ on speciality hand-dyed yarn creating her dress. To keep her dress hidden from her husband Travis, , she created the dress at work.Average dress price in New York: £,. - Victoria paid £. for material for her look Average professional centrepiece flower in New York: £,. - Victoria paid £. on fake flowers and bells Average professional catering dessert in New York: £ - Victoria paid £. for meringue ingredients All  wedding guests were impressed with Victoriaaposs DIY dress. She said: “My husband said that I looked like a princess, whilst others said that I looked like the Disney Princess Belle throughout the day.” Victoria also created her own centrepieces with plastic flowers from US craft shop Michaels and bells from the Dollar Store.  She was initially quoted £ for desserts and decided to save even more by spending eight hours creating  meringues in a iety of flavours. Victoria only spent £ - giving her a massive  per cent saving. She added: Iaposd say that I absolutely saved money on my wedding, especially with the dress, as in New York they tend to costs thousands. title: forgotten ghost town submerged underwater
story: :root Forgotten ghost town submerged underwater  years ago reappears in droughtDrone test pilot Devon Dewey shared incredible snaps on Twitter following a serious drought which revealed the foundations of the forgotten town of Rockport in Utah, USDrone pilot Devon Dewey captured incredible footage of the forgotten town of Rockport Image: Devon DeweyByDimitris KouimtsidisRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Sep | commentsA forgotten aposghost townapos that was submerged underwater after a dam was built has risen from its watery grave  years later. The town of Rockport in Utah, US, disappeared completely in  - five years after the White House green lit the construction of the Wanship Dam.At the time, a total of  families still lived in the once thriving little town, located in a narrow part of Weber Valley at the mouth of Three Mile Canyon, reports the Daily Star. The remaining residents protested against the development but the government went ahead and purchased the entire valley, and in preparation for the dam, created the Rockport Reservoir, quickly submerging the whole community.Last week, drone test pilot Devon Dewey shared incredible snaps on Twitter following a serious drought which revealed the foundations of the old town. Do you have any drone images to rival Devonaposs  Let us know at webnews@mirrorHe told KSL News : It was really interesting to be standing at an overlook for the reservoir and to see faint traces of foundations of old homes and a road all below where the water would normally be. The whole area is pretty flat and unorm, so even though the foundations are old and mostly gone, you can still see them clearlyyou know where to look.Using a drone to get a higher perspective helped to see where structures once stood over  years ago.  The town was first settled in . After the government purchased the land nearly a hundred years later, some of the buildings were removed so that they could be preserved for history. They were moved to Pioneer Village at Lagoon Amusement Park in Farmington. Following this year’s drought, only small boats and personal watercraft are allowed to launch, although officials have advised people to do so “at your own risk”. Even though water levels have declined, the ground may be muddy from years of being underwater, so officials have advised people to be cautious and use dronesthey want to see the remnants of the ‘ghost town’. news us-news who-gabby-petitos-fianc-brian-"Police Visit Home of Brian LaundrieByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Sep  Police are desperately searching for Brian Laundrie – the fiancé of YouTuber Gabby Petito whose body was found in a remote area of Wyoming. The FBI have confirmed that the -year-oldaposs death was ruled homicide, but an official cause of death has not yet been confirmed. Her fiancé has been named a person of interest in the case, and his whereabouts are unknown.Michael Schneider, special agent in charge of the FBIaposs Denver office, said: Mr Brian Laundrie has been named a person of interest. Anyone with information concerning Mr Laundrieaposs role in this matter or his current whereabouts should contact the FBI.  Laundrie has not been seen since September , after ing to his home in Florida. Who is Brian Laundrie  Brian Laundrie, , and Gabby were high school sweethearts. They both went to the same school in Bayport, New York. In , the couple moved to North Port to live with Laundrieaposs parents.In July  Gabby announced through Instagram that she and Laundrie were engaged. Gabby was on a cross-country road trip with Laundrie when she disappeared. They began their trip in New York, and were supposed to be any for four months while visiting national parks. They documented their travels on their Instagram account and YouTube, showing pictures and clips of them kissing and scaling rocks. Gabby was reported missing when her fiancé ed from the road trip without her.  She was last seen checking out of a hotel in Utah on August , and on September  Laundrie ed without her. He himself disappeared on September . A park ranger has now said he tried telling Gabby that her relationship seemed toxic after being called to a domestic incident between the two.Melissa Hulls, the visitor and resource protection supervisor at Arches National Park, had approached Gabby after the pair had an argument on August . She told Deseret News: I was imploring with her to reevaluate the relationship, asking hershe was happy in the relationship with him, and basically saying this was an opportunity for her to find another path, to make a change in her le.” What happened to Gabby Petito   Gabbyaposs body was discovered in a remote area of Bridger-Teton National Forest, in western Wyoming on September . FBI Denver Special Agent Michael Schneider said in a statement: The FBI and our partners remain dedicated to ensuring anyone responsible for or complicit in Ms. Petitoaposs death is held accountable for their actions. It is not yet known exactly what happened to Gabby, but the autopsy revealed her death was homicide. Police have since released body camera footage of an encounter two officers had with Gabby and Brian on August . The footage shows Gabby crying, and she reports having an argument with Brian that had become physical. Neither of them were detained, but the officers insisted they spend the night apart. Her fiancé Laundrie was last seen on September . Before he vanished, Laundrie refused to speak with investigators and retained a lawyer. The North Port Police Department told Insider: We showed up. We see the vehicle. We take the vehicle. We make an attempt to talk with Brian, and his family declined to make him available, and they gave us the information for his attorney.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON CrimeGabby Petito" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. remains were found on  September. The remains were found in the Grand Teton National Park in the US state of Wyoming. Forensic analysis has since shown that the remains belong to Petito.It is a case that has drawn a huge amount of interest in the US, online and around the world.Petito, , was visiting the park with her fiancé Brian Laundrie, , after embarking on a road trip in July. She was last seen on  August and spoke to her mother one day later. A final Instagram post was uploaded on  August. Two text messages were received from Petitoaposs mobile phone since the call on  August, the last of which was on  August, but it is not confirmed who they were sent by. Her family reported her missing on  September. Laundrie ed alone to the coupleaposs home in Florida on September , before himself going missing on  September, the day before Petitoaposs body was found. Police also confirmed an incident between the pair on  August. The police were called after witnesses saw Laundrie allegedly slapping Petito. Ms Petitoaposs mother Nicole Schmidt, told ABC News about the final call with her daughter: She sounded good and excited to continue her trip and excited to start her YouTube channel. She seemed OK. A coroner has since confirmed Petito was murdered. Who was Gabby Petito   Petito grew up in Blue Point a hamlet in the town of Brookhaven, Long Island in the state of New York. She was an aspiring blogger and YouTuber who documented her le with her fiance, whom she met at the local high school they both attended. title: flight attendants secret code used
story: :root Flight attendant uses codewords to talk about passengers without them knowingA flight attendant has shared a secret code that she uses to talk about passengers to other cabin crew without them knowing, and you might have heard it about yourselfCabin crew use secret codes to refer to people on the plane Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA flight attendant has shared her secret code that she uses to talk about plane passengers without their knowledge. Known only as LJ, the woman said that often she will talk to other members of the cabin crew about passengers that she finds attractive, but she does it in secret.She said that the code she uses is universally understood, and others in the know will reply in kind to comment their opinion - and all the while the passengers are in the dark, as the Daily Star reports.LJ said she will refer to passengers as food, asking others aposwhat do you want to have for dinner tonightapos, and the other member of the cabin crew will say whether they would eat that food too. Speaking on the Confessions on the Fly podcast, flight attendant LJ said: I’ve picked up a dude on an aircraft, on my way to Austin four years ago. He was really cute. We had a couple of fun dates.My co-worker and I had this code ‘what do you want to have for dinner tonight ’ And you would say Italian or this or that. But we were really talking about the dudes coming on the aircraft. So we would have a code of like ‘no, I’m not really hungry for that’ or when somebody hot was coming on I’d be like, ‘oh yeah I’ll definitely go out for that tonight’. When somebody came on who was really really cute, I was like ‘oh yeah I definitely want whatever it was – Italian – for the night’. LJ then explained in further detail how she and her flight attendant friend Tony had employed their secret code to successfully get a passengers’ number. I bought him a drink on the aircraft and then when he came to the back of the aircraft to go to the restroom, my co-worker started talking to him, just warming him up or whatever, she continued. And then I jumped in and Tony casually walks to the front of the aircraft and gives us time to chat… and then I got his number. On the podcast episode, LJ also shared some tips for passengers who might want to make a move on cabin crew. Her main piece of advice, she noted, was that passengers should not try it on while attendants are doing service. That’s very awkward... If you want to grab our attention, being nice and courteous is rule number one, she added. Saying please and thank yous…you ask me how my day is or anything like that, I am so totally thrown off guard, because nobody talks to me other than to ask for a diet coke or whatever. So that, number one, perks me up and makes me actually look at you and pay attention.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-terried-after-discovering-someone-"TikTok user says she’s ‘scared’ after finding AirTag on her carByJohn BettAudience WriterSimon GreenVideo News Editor:,  Sep | commentsA woman was left terried after discovering someone had hidden a tracker on her car - and she has no clue who put it there or why. Ashley Estrada had been out with her cousin when all of a sudden her iPhone detected a nearby Apple AirTag, so the pair tried to find out.To their surprise, it was on Ashleyaposs car - hidden behind the licence plate - and whoever placed it there would have been able to track Ashleyaposs movements, as the Daily Star reports.Ashley, from Los Angeles, US, said she had no idea who had placed the device there - and shared a video of the discovery to spread awareness of just how easy it is to track people.What do you think about Ashleyaposs shocking discovery  Let us know in the comments...In the video, Ashley said: I’m literally f***ing shaking – look what I just found on my car. Her cousin then shows the app on her phone which reveals the device has tracked the car’s every stop. In a later video, Ashley explained she discovered the tracker after her cousin’s girlfriend got a notication that an AirTag had been detected nearby. I was hanging out with my cousinaposs girlfriend, and next thing you know she gets a notication on her phone, which is how we found out because it told us.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. It says first seen at :, so thataposs when they put it on my car. Then it said aposPlay Sound,apos which is what we did...and this is how we were able to detect where it was at on my car. She added that she plans to contact Apple with the details of the tag in the hope of finding who it belongs to. Since the videos were shared, thousands of people flooded the comments section sharing their horror at what they saw. “Imagine she didn’t have an iPhone and never even knew she was being tracked,” one said. Another commented: “This is so scary, please stay safe, keep us updated.”Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: your child could next mini
story: :root Your child could be the next mini Birds Eye Captain and be featured on Fish Finger packsDoes your little one love Fish Fingers  If so Birds Eye and Iceland are launching an exciting search to find one lucky child who will have the chance to become the new mini Captain Birds EyeDoes your child love Fish Fingers Image: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  Sep | commentsCalling all wannabe Captains, Birds Eye and frozen experts at Iceland have some news for you.They are searching the high seas to find a new aposminiapos Captain Birds Eye to replace the iconic captain on packs of Fish Fingers in Iceland stores across the UK for a limited time.And all your little one has to do to be in with a chance of winning the prize is submit their very own unique Birds Eye Fish Finger recipe, along with the inspiration behind the tasty creation. The nationwide competition is open to children aged  to  years old.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Mike Sowerby, Marketing Manager at Birds Eye, said: We know children are much more engaged in mealtimesthey are involved in cooking the food they eat. We want to inspire and encourage children to get creative with a mealtime staple, think Fish Finger pancakes with a dollop of custard, we want to see the most creative, inventive, yet tastiest recipes out there. We hope by crowning a talented Mini Captain on our iconic Fish Finger packs, it will inspire families across the nation to get their little ones involved in mealtimes and explore where their food comes from.Andrew Staniland, Trading Director, at Iceland Foods, added: Mealtimes are all about family time and Birds Eye Fish Fingers have always been a staple in Iceland’s freezers and on the tables of UK families. We’re delighted to be teaming up with Birds Eye once again to find the newest Mini Captain Birds Eye.For mealtime inspiration, budding Captains can head into Iceland stores to get all their ingredients to make the winning dish from pre-chopped vegetables to herbs and spices frozen and ready to go there’s everything needed for a show-stopping dish.Parents can help children nominate themselves by submitting their Birds Eye Fish Finger recipe via www.birdseyeminicaptain to be in with a chance of winning the unique prize.Entries close on th October  and the winning Mini Captain will be featured on limited-edition packs exclusively at Iceland in January .Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news world-news amazing-moment-lump-fiery-space-"Moment meteorite flies into Earths atmosphere over Europe in ByKate Buck:,  Sep A meteorite which hurtled down to earth in a fiery ball has been found after dashcam detectives joined forces to track down where it landed. The ball of space rock flew through the air towards southern Slovenia on February  , and scientists launched a year-long mission to discover it to unlock secrets about the solar system. Researchers used dashcam footage of the incident from Slovenia, Croatia, Italy, Austria and Hungary to try to track where it landed. Dr Denis Vida of the University of Western Ontario presented the preliminary results of the hunt for space rocks and subsequent study at the aposEuroplanet Science Congressapos virtual meeting, which is being held this week. The meteorite, which has been named aposNovo Mestoapos after a nearby Slovenian city, was caught on tape in several countries by dashcams and security cameras. According to the study, the meteorite created a loud explosion and a powerful flash that lasted for . seconds. As it fell, the rock experienced  million pascals, equivalent to  times the pressure of a car tyre, one of the highest measurements recorded for a space rock.  The immense pressure and scalding heat broke the space rock, which would have weighed an estimated four metric tons before entering the earthaposs atmosphere, into  small fragments. Experts were able to recover three of the rock fragments weighing  grammes , which have been sent to laboratories for analysis. Despite the successful recovery of these three fragments, the hunt is still on for a huge -kilogrammefragment, which experts are concerned may have landed in a muddy field and been ploughed over by a farmer.  According to the study, the space rock is an aposordinary chondriteapos meteorite, which is by far the most numerous group and comprises about  per cent of all meteorite finds on earth. Despite being aposordinaryapos, researchers believe that the rock is linked to the Solar System region where Near-Earth Objects exist, and its examination could reveal new information about our solar systemaposs origins.  According to the statement: Rocks from space provide opportunities to understand the history of our Solar System and are important in studies of how le arose on Earth. However, fall locations often remain unknown or hidden and the space rocksapos scientic messages are then lost. Vida said: By combining observations from several cameras around  kilometres apart, a fireballaposs position can be pinpointed to within  metres, and itaposs usually fairly easy to compute its atmospheric trajectory and pre-atmospheric orbit this way. He added: The fireballaposs path is in a volume of the worldaposs sky among the most densely observed by specialist night-operating cameras. Its path would have been caught by at least it happened just a few hours earlier.  However, as the meteorite crashed into the earth during the day, it was only recorded by car dashcams, forcing the experts to get creative with their attempt to locate the space rock fragments. The team said in the statement: To help create D models, local people were asked to take several photographs from known locations of buildings, telephone posts, distant mountains, and other landmarks visible in the dashcam videos.  It added: The images enabled triangulation of exact locations accurate to within a few centimetres. Analysis of the Novo Mesto space rock is ongoing as scientists hope to gain valuable information from it about our solar system. The hunt for the lost giant fragment continues.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON University of Western OntarioMeteors" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: fitness fanatic told shes weeks
story: :root Fitness fanatic discovers shes  months pregnant despite still having toned absRevonni Adams, , visited the doctor complaining of indigestion - but was told she was around eight months pregnant despite having never missed a period and having no sign of a baby bumpRevonni Adams in the gym before finding out she was pregnant Image: CATERS NEWSByBeth KilgallonKate Buck:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep A fitness fanatic with abs of steel was shocked to be told she was eight months pregnant - despite having never missed a period or grown a baby bump. Revonni Adams, , went to the doctor complaining of severe indigestion, without realising the real cause was her advanced pregnancy. The trainee accountant, from Windhoek, Namibia, had been taking acid indigestion medication for some time, but made the appointment after it stopped working. With visible abs and no missing periods, Revonni never expected the doctor to tell her that she was in fact eight months pregnant. She said: As I laid down for the doctor to do the check-up, the last thing either of us was expecting was to hear aposyouaposre pregnantapos. I was in so much shock that I was arguing with a professional on why it seemed impossible for me to be pregnant. I looked at my partner and he was dead silent. I was lowkey happy but I didnapost want to seem excited or get my hopes up because, in my mind, the doctor definitely made a mistake. The drive home was absolutely silent, we were both in our minds just trying to wrap our heads around the fact that in a few weeks, I would actually be giving birth to a whole person.  But eventually my partner disrupted the silence by laughing and saying that my barbecue wings and peanut butter cravings now all made sense. The possibility of pregnancy hadnapost even crossed my mind because I wasnapost missing my period and I literally still had abs. I had absolutely no signs at all, I never missed my period, I had no morning sickness, weight gain or even tummy growth. Nothing at all. So you could understand my reasoning for arguing with the doctor after that revelation. Revonni and her -year-old partner, who she doesnapost wish to name, are both fitness fanatics and love to spend time in the gym. Her partner is also her personal trainer, and helped her achieve chiselled abs that were visible until the last few weeks of her pregnancy. She added: For about three years now, Iaposve been on acid indigestion medication, so every time I consume carbonated drinks or spicy foods, I experience nausea, severe cramps, extreme bloating and basic loss of appetite.  As a result of this, I became so ill- fatigue, nausea, bloating and severe cramps. I decided to go to the doctor and renew my prescription for my acid indigestion medication. I lay on the bed debriefing my symptoms to the doctors and as sheaposs feeling my tummy she tells me aposNo no dear, youaposre pregnant.apos My immediate reaction was to laugh and start giving her all my reasons for why that seemed impossible. She insisted that the head was already facing down and explained I could give birth any minute now. She first said I was around  weeks, but after an ultrasound to confirm we found out that I was  weeks pregnant. I was in denial. Imagine going to the doctor for an acid problem and being told youaposre actually about to give birth to a stranger. As soon as I found out I was expecting a baby, I swear my bump began to aggressively pop over the remaining few weeks of my pregnancy. Revonni and her partner have been together for two years and regularly joke about having five children together, however, they didnapost expect it would happen so soon. She says that theyaposre both still young and that their careers are only just commencing, so they werenapost expecting to have a family until further into the future. Revonni added: Our only concern was the adjustments that we had to start making, in terms of finance, health, and our professional careers. What my family would say was never a concern for me, I have the most loving and supportive mum. I called her the day we found out and sheaposs been buying baby stuff ever since. I am so excited now, to be honest. I cannot wait to meet my little human. Iaposm past my due date now so weaposre expecting our little acid reflux baby any day now. Obviously it took a minute to settle into the idea of having sleepless nights and losing my very toned abs but I can honestly say that thereaposs never been any feeling of regret or shame since I found out. Iaposm nervous yes, but definitely more excited.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON BabiesPregnancyGiving birthPersonal trainerPrescriptionsFitnessMorning sicknessPeriods" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: german man admits strangling brit
story: :root German man admits strangling Brit heiress girlfriend during sex but denies murderAnna Florence Reed, from North Yorkshire, was found dead at Hotel La Palma au Lac, a four-star lakeside hotel in the southern Swiss municipality of Muralto on April   with her former boyfriend Dirk W." content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _PAY-Newsflash-BristishHeiressScarf-.jpg" width"" "" British millionaire heiress Anna Florence Reedwith her former boyfriend Dirk W Image: NewsflashByMirror:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep A German man on trial for the death of his British millionaire heiress girlfriend has admitted to strangling her with a towel during sex but denies killing her for her fortune. Appearing on Monday in front of a courtroom in the Swiss town of Lugano, in the Ticino region, Dirk W. told the court of how he was having sex with -year-old Anna Florence Reed on their bathroom floor when he put a hand towel around her neck. “Then I pressed on it with my hands, as we had done a hundred times before. Suddenly she stopped moving, her tongue was sticking out. I tried to resuscitate her,” he said. Ms Reed, from North Yorkshire, was found dead at Hotel La Palma au Lac, a four-star lakeside hotel in the southern Swiss municipality of Muralto on April  .The defendant, who has also been named as Marc Schatzle, or Marc S during some coverage of the case, maintains her death was the result of a sex game gone wrong.The prosecution believes he murdered the young woman to appropriate her fortune.  Her credit card, which was missing at the time of her death, was found in the ceiling of the hotel lt four months after the alleged crime. The defendant told the court he placed it there as a prank after his girlfriend complained about always paying for everything. The court heard how the pair had consumed alcohol and cocaine and had argued on the night before her death. During the court case, he was asked detailed questions by the judge, about their sex le on the date Ms Reed died and how did it come to pass that they played the strangulation game.  However, the defendant was unable to answer many of the questions because of the time distance involved, and also because he was very drunk on that date. His lack of recall over the events of the night, paired with his lestyle sleeping with hundreds of women over the years and living a VIP lestyle without worrying about his obligations to his two children, were key points considered in the case. However, the court also criticised the prosecutoraposs case in particular over failures of the investigators to ascertain the precise time of death of the young woman when called to the crime scene. The court case continues.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Court caseCredit cardsCrimeCelebrity love livesCocaine" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our money-saving tips and top offers direct to your inbox with the Mirror Money newsletterInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: men car boot full kfc
story: :root Men with car boot ‘full of KFC’ arrested while trying to enter city with takeaway banWhen police officers searched the car, they discovered three buckets of KFC,  tubs of coleslaw and numerous boxes of fries, as well as £, in cash - with takeaway services banned due to lockdownNew Zealand police found a car boot full of KFCByLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Sep | commentsTwo men found with a car boot “full of KFC” have been arrested after attempting to cross the border into a New Zealand city in breach of the country’s strict Covid- lockdown restrictions. The pair of suspected gang associates were flagged down as they travelled from Hamilton, about  miles south of Auckland, police said. When officers searched their car, they discovered three buckets of fried chicken,  tubs of coleslaw and numerous boxes of fries, as well as £, in cash. The two men, aged  and , are due to appear in court and face a fine of more than £, or six months of prisonfound guilty of breaking public health rules. Their arrest came amid a shutdown of Auckland, New Zealand’s largest city, that has been in place since  August.  Under the level four shutdown restrictions, all restaurants and cafes – including take-away services are closed. A breach of the Covid- Public Health Response Act can result in imprisonment for up to six months or a large fine. After nearly five weeks, Auckland moved out of its highest setting on Monday. Police said further charges are likely and an investigation is ongoing. A police spokesperson said officers made the arrest after noticing a suspicious-looking vehicle travelling on the outskirts of the city.  They said: “Upon seeing the police car, the vehicle did a u-turn and sped off trying to evade police. “The vehicle was searched and police located the cash, alongside empty ounce bags and a large amount of takeaways. Last week, a -year-old man was charged after he posted a TikTok video showing him leaving Auckland and purchasing a large meal from McDonaldaposs.  It comes as New Zealand says it may not get back to having no coronavirus cases in the community again as the Delta iant spreads.New Zealand eliminated Covid- last year and had been largely virus-free until the latest outbreak of the Delta iant erupted in August, prompting Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern to order a nationwide lockdown.Ashley Bloomfield, the director general of health told Radio New Zealand: We may not get back to zero but the important thing is we are going to keep finding any infections and basically continue to contact trace, test and isolate people so that we stop the virus circulating in the community... thataposs the aim. Bloomfield said the aim now was to try and get on top of the outbreak while also ramping up vaccination rates after a delayed start, with nearly % of the population now fully vaccinated. title: mystery empty purse belonging woman
story: :root Mystery as empty purse belonging to woman found in sea with no memory discoveredThe woman, who speaks ‘perfect English’, was found covered in blood waving at a fisherman on the isle of Krk in CroatiaRescuers lead the mystery woman to safety Image: Croatia PoliceByLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Sep | commentsThe belongings of a woman who was found on a rock in the northern Adriatic sea with no memory of who she is have been recovered by Croatian police. Officers searching the isle of Krk found the woman’s backpack and purse on Tuesday, about  metres from where she was first rescued on  September.A police source told the local news site sata that the purse had no documents or money . Photographs have also emerged showing a rescue team lting her onto a stretcher and taking her to an ambulance. The woman - believed to be in her s - was originally spotted waving at a fisherman from a jagged outcrop of rock off the island.  He then called for help, and a team of  people used xs and walked two miles across jagged rocks on the isle to rescue her. The woman, who speaks English like a professor”, was covered in blood and had no idea how she came to be on the rock, nor could she remember her own name. She was not carrying a passport, papers, or phone and was reportedly dehydrated and emaciated. Officials said she was so weak she could barely take a sip of water. Local authorities have said no one has come forward to identy her. On Sunday, police released the woman’s details and photograph after spending a week trying without success to identy her. She has been described by local officials as being ft in with shoulder- hair, wearing a pink hat, striped top and dark trousers.  A police spokesperson said: “Various methods have been tried to establish her identity but so far none have proved successful.” Experts say she had managed to survive several nights, despite terrying wildle, including bears, prowling the island. One person told Sata: Itaposs weird that she was looking in the area at all. It is an extremely inaccessible part of the bay with terribly sharp rocks - literally razors that cut the rubber on your shoes. “There is no le or animals except maybe wild boars or bears which know how to swim to here in search of food, but this is a rarity because there is no food, nothing. A woman that age certainly could not swim that distance, it needs exceptional strength. A local of Soline, the small village from where the woman was discovered said the woman had not been staying in the village because she would have been recognised. Another, from neighbouring Klimno, suggested she may have “strayed while walking, fell, and lost her memory due to a blow to the head.” Krk is a popular holiday destination particularly with holidaymakers from southern Germany, Austria, Italy and Hungary. title: mystery woman found no memory
story: :root Mystery of woman found with no memory on rock at sea solved with bizarre TV linkThe woman, who speaks ‘perfect English’, was found covered in blood waving at a fisherman on the isle of Krk in Croatia. Her empty purse was also later found around  metres awayPeople in LA claim to recognise the woman as Daniela Adamcova, a jewellery maker Image: Croatia PoliceBySophie Corcoran:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsThe mystery of a woman found covered in blood on a rock at sea in Croatia has reportedly been solved. The woman - believed to be in her s - was originally spotted waving at a fisherman from a jagged outcrop of land of rock off the island of Krk. The man called for help and a team of  people used xs and walked two miles across jagged rocks on the isle to rescue the woman who has been said to speak English like a professor. She was not carrying a passport, papers, or phone and was reportedly dehydrated and emaciated. Officials said she was so weak she could barely take a sip of water. It was reported the woman had no memory of who she was. Her belongings, made up of her backpack and purse, were on Tuesday found on a rock in the northern Adriatic sea around  metres from where she was rescued on September .Do you know more about this mystery  Get in touch with us at webnews@mirror The fisherman who called for help said he had seen the mystery woman just a day before. He said: We saw the woman on the shore in a very inaccessible part. I thought maybe she was on a walk because she didnapost show that she needed help. She didnapost wave, call or anything. The next morning we saw the woman in the same place, it was already suspicious to us now. We saw her nervously walking up and down and when she saw us, she started yelling and waving. Police issued an appeal to identy the woman as no one came forward. However, people in Los Angeles claim to recognise the woman as Daniela Adamcova, a jewellery maker in Hollywood. The Sun reports that Danielaaposs jewellery has appeared in films and TV show Friends. A string of A-listers including Barbra Streisand, Diana Ross and Brigitte Bardot as said to be fans of her designs. She is said to be originally form Slovakia and has spent time living in the UK and Ireland. The woman found on the isle of Krk was described as ft in and blonde by police. According to sources, her accent drts between professional English and Eastern European. It has been said the woman speaks like a professor.  The Sun says it was press coverage of the woman being found that has led to her mystery being solved.A friend of Daniela, Kelecic Miriam, from Slovakia who is now living in Croatia, told the Sun she recognised her and posted a photograph of her holding necklaces on Facebook.She said she contacted Croatian police, who had also been informed of her identity by Slovakian journalists. Other friends in LA also recognised her.  Nina Smidt told The Daily Beast the woman was Daniela, known as Dana, who worked as an artisan at a company where she was a manager in . She had been placed there by a charity that helps the homeless, she said. The companyaposs landlord Tyler Madsen allowed Dana to live there rent-free so she could save up money before moving to Ireland the same year. She said: I recognised the woman in the photo immediately. The second I saw her picture, I sent it to Tyler to confirm that it was her, which he confirmed. Tyler added: One hundred-per-cent - there is no doubt in my mind itaposs her. Friends have said Dana liked to travel alone. news world-news time-traveller--claims-hes-"Man claiming to be ‘time traveller’ walks around empty streetsBySophie Corcoran:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA TikTok user claiming he is a time traveller has shared footage of the year . aposJavierapos claims the videos he posts on the social media app proves he is the last human alive after the apocalypse. The footage shows deserted streets in Spain lined with cars and buildings. There is not a person in sight. Javier also takes viewers on a walk past flats and a childrenaposs playground, although the scene is like a ghost town with no people seen on camera. He captioned the footage: Day  alone in the world. Another clip that appears to have been filmed with a drone and shows him standing on his own on a beach. What do you think about this time travelleraposs tale  Have your say in the comments  Javier has . million followers on TikTok so far where he posts similar videos showing deserted scenes in Valencia. His account is called @unicosobreviviente which translates to Only Survivor. He posted his first video in February this year and said the Spanish city was deserted. The caption on that first video read: I just woke up in a hospital and I donapost know what might have happened. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Today is February ,  and I am alone in the city. In another post he wrote: Humanity has been extinct. There is no one in the shopping centres. Javier also asks for help from his followers, saying: I keep trying to find human le. I am starting to lose hope. Today I got something to eat. How long is this going to last  Mention in the comments who might be able to help me.  Some TikTok users ask questions to debunk Javieraposs posts, but replies. When asked why there is still electricity to power lights and internet, he replied that he wasnapost sure but said most likely there is a type of connection between  and . He also claims that he is stuck and is trying to find a way back to . story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access The Courier and the EveningePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to The Courier or the EveningePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on    Monday – Friday, am – pm, or email.Your subscription to The Courier will allow you to access all of the Eveningstories which are now available on The Courier website. All of the best Eveningcontent, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on The Courier website and will be available for you as part of your subscription. If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Courier ePaper.The new website is now live. Eveningcontent can now be found on The Courier website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. If you purchase a new subscription through The Courier website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. These can all be found on The Courier website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from the courts. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Tele content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. concrete proof  It’s time to introduce the @BelongAberdeen Gargoyles, opening th October.Find out more https:t.co PTBSlOxfAQ pic KaOJiBlxzmdash Belong Gaming Arenas UKSeptember , And every year the brand hosts an annual tournaments # competing with the tens of other Belong Gaming venues across the UK.The new centre is at Berryden Retail Park.Players will be known as the Aberdeen Gargoyles and can take on dferent stages in games like Overwatch and League of Legends to become finalists on stage at events, including Insomnia at the NEC, Birmingham.After joining the Aberdeen squad, players will be able to represent the city across all their tournaments # wearing the squad#s custom jersey.Players will also have the chance to develop their skills during community nights.Each seat is kitted out with a PC, Xbox and PlayStation, surrounded by neon lighting in a futuristic dark setting.Gaming societies will also be able to make use of the facilities.For as little as £. a month you can access all of our content, including Premium articles.
